page.title: 11WHAT CAN WE BUY?
page.content:
Bottled{milk}is delivered to houses and farms every day. There is currently a choice of roundsmen, both coming from outside the area.
There is{no shop}in the village, so even for a loaf of bread it is necessary to make a trip to Sharnbrook or further afield. (The village bakehouse now serves as accommodation for a car!) A few people keep poultry but they produce only enough{eggs}for themselves and their friends.
The Evening Telegraph{newspaper}is produced in Bedford every day except Sunday. A lady in Souldrop village delivers it every night to those houses that buy it. The free paper 'Bedford on Sunday' is delivered to all the houses in the area.
